metadata.synopsis: Group dialog with priestess Yannis and the hollyphant detective.The tollyphant tells Yannis that she has solved the crime and leaves afterwards.!!! It is possible for the player to solve the murder case before this dialog happens, so we need to have a reactivity to it.

31.speaker: Sister Yannis
31.text: Look, Investigator, Brilgor might have been a criminal, but he was no murderer. You're missing something, you have to be -
31.context: CinematicNodeContext: we begin with Yannis and Valeria arguing. Yannis is already very upset and frustrated.

37.speaker: Valeria
37.text: Enough, Yannis! Listen to yourself. You are defending a man who ritually slaughtered your high priest.
37.context: CinematicNodeContext: The hollyphant stops circling yannis, delivers the line "case closed," and then begins to leave

57.speaker: Valeria
57.text: The evidence speaks for itself. Brilgor killed Father Lorgan, then be it out of shame, or profane duty, offed himself with the same blade. Case closed, Sister Yannis.
57.context: CinematicNodeContext: The hollyphant stops circling yannis, delivers the line "case closed," and then begins to leave

34.speaker: Sister Yannis
34.context: CinematicNodeContext: 'shitey little elephant' directed at valeria (who is offstage), 'oh' turns to player

14.text: Shitey little elephant. Oh, um. I apologise, stranger, language like that hardly befits a rector of Ilmater.
14.context: CinematicNodeContext: 'shitey little elephant' directed at valeria (who is offstage), 'oh' turns to player

18.speaker: Sister Yannis
18.text: Shitey little elephant. Oh, um. I apologise, stranger, language like that hardly befits a rector of Ilmater.
18.context: CinematicNodeContext: 'shitey little elephant' directed at valeria (who is offstage), 'oh' turns to player

17.speaker: Player
17.text: Sounded like you were having quite the disagreement.
17.context: NodeContext: Quietly cynical - she has her experience of investigating murders. Distaste for the city's rejection of refugees.

10.speaker: Player
10.context: NodeContext: Quietly cynical - she has her experience of investigating murders. Distaste for the city's rejection of refugees.

56.speaker: Sister Yannis
56.text: Thank you. I normally wouldn't speak so harshly, but these are rather unique circumstances.

23.speaker: Player
23.text: Don't apologise, sounded like a load of bollocks anyway.
23.context: NodeContext: Quietly cynical - she has her experience of investigating murders. Distaste for the city's rejection of refugees.

79.speaker: Sister Yannis
79.text: I wouldn't go that far, but the Investigator is being particularly challenging right now.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: Don't apologise. Brilgor couldn't have killed Father Lorgan. He doesn't fit the killer's profile.
20.context: NodeContext: Quietly cynical - she has her experience of investigating murders. Distaste for the city's rejection of refugees.

72.speaker: Player
72.text: I don't imagine Ilmater cares about you swearing.
72.context: NodeContext: Quietly cynical - she has her experience of investigating murders. Distaste for the city's rejection of refugees.

29.speaker: Player
29.text: Given the circumstances, I think Ilmater will forgive you. My god would.
29.context: NodeContext: Quietly cynical - she has her experience of investigating murders. Distaste for the city's rejection of refugees.

41.speaker: Sister Yannis
41.text: He who shoulders the suffering of others can never be weak. But...
41.context: NodeContext: Quietly cynical - she has her experience of investigating murders. Distaste for the city's rejection of refugees.

36.speaker: Sister Yannis
36.text: Thank you, friend. I am grateful for your compassion.
36.context: NodeContext: Quietly cynical - she has her experience of investigating murders. Distaste for the city's rejection of refugees.

32.speaker: Sister Yannis
32.text: Better to occasionally contradict one's morals than to have none. That being said...
32.context: NodeContext: Quietly cynical - she has her experience of investigating murders. Distaste for the city's rejection of refugees.

15.speaker: Sister Yannis
15.text: I suppose you're right. The Crying One has much more on his plate than curse words, given what just happened here.
15.context: NodeContext: Quietly cynical - she has her experience of investigating murders. Distaste for the city's rejection of refugees.

82.speaker: Player
82.context: NodeContext: Quietly cynical - she has her experience of investigating murders. Distaste for the city's rejection of refugees.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: Ah, yes, Father Lorgan's passing. My condolences.
9.context: NodeContext: Quietly cynical - she has her experience of investigating murders. Distaste for the city's rejection of refugees.

54.speaker: Sister Yannis
54.context: NodeContext: Quietly cynical - she has her experience of investigating murders. Distaste for the city's rejection of refugees.

40.speaker: Sister Yannis
40.text: Two people just died on temple grounds. Our high priest, Father Lorgan, and one of the new refugees, Brilgor.
40.context: NodeContext: Quietly cynical - she has her experience of investigating murders. Distaste for the city's rejection of refugees.

4.speaker: Sister Yannis
4.text: Investigator Valeria thinks it a murder, and is content to blame Brilgor. The politically convenient target.
4.context: NodeContext: Quietly cynical - she has her experience of investigating murders. Distaste for the city's rejection of refugees.

59.speaker: Player
59.text: If you think the Investigator did a shoddy job, I can look into the murder for you.
59.context: NodeContext: Quietly cynical - she has her experience of investigating murders. Distaste for the city's rejection of refugees.

61.speaker: Player
61.context: NodeContext: Quietly cynical - she has her experience of investigating murders. Distaste for the city's rejection of refugees.

1.speaker: Sister Yannis
1.text: Brilgor was a refugee. No one sticks up for them at the best of times, and with Gortash in power...
1.context: NodeContext: Quietly cynical - she has her experience of investigating murders. Distaste for the city's rejection of refugees.

70.speaker: Player
70.text: They make a fine target for the real culprit, too - unlikely to be missed where they weren't wanted to begin with.
70.context: NodeContext: Quietly cynical - she has her experience of investigating murders. Distaste for the city's rejection of refugees.

80.speaker: Jaheira
80.text: They make a fine target for the real culprit, too - unlikely to be missed where they weren't wanted to begin with.
80.context: NodeContext: Quietly cynical - she has her experience of investigating murders. Distaste for the city's rejection of refugees.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: Well, I expect the Flaming Fist will ban refugee aid now one of them's blamed for murder.

77.speaker: Sister Yannis
77.text: Well, I expect the Flaming Fist will ban refugee aid now one of them's blamed for murder.

66.speaker: Player
66.text: Let me help you - I'll look around, see if there's anything to prove Brilgor innocent.

0.speaker: Sister Yannis
0.text: Feel free to look around the temple - but fair warning. The Investigator won't change her mind without significant new evidence.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: Where can I find the Investigator?

8.speaker: Sister Yannis
8.text: Sharess' Caress would be my best bet. That's her usual haunt after 'closing' a case.

19.speaker: Player
19.text: Any idea what I should be looking for?

60.speaker: Sister Yannis
60.text: Valeria never found the murder weapon, so that could be a start. Anything disproving the refugee murder-suicide angle, really.

78.speaker: Player
78.text: Can you tell me where to find Shirra Clarwen?

33.speaker: Sister Yannis
33.text: I can tell you where to find her, but she won't be very chatty, I'm afraid.

2.speaker: Sister Yannis
2.text: Shirra passed away last year - peacefully, mind. We buried her in the crypt under the temple, if you wish to visit.

21.speaker: Sister Yannis
21.text: I really hope you find something. For all our sakes.

68.speaker: Player
68.text: I'm sure there are plenty of people from Baldur's Gate who still need your help.

44.speaker: Sister Yannis
44.text: You think Ilmater looks at a Baldurian differently to anyone else? I like to think the gods are smarter than that.

53.speaker: Sister Yannis
53.text: Now, if you'll excuse me, I've a temple to run and a high priest to replace.

39.speaker: Player
39.text: Stick to being a place of worship. Helping people got your high priest killed.

52.speaker: Sister Yannis
52.text: If we don't help them, who will? The kind Lord Gortash? Don't make me laugh.

67.speaker: Player
67.text: Aiding others is Ilmater's will. If I proved Brilgor's innocence, would that help?

75.speaker: Player
75.text: No murder story I've ever read has ended simply - I bet there's more afoot here.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: Allow me to help you - my god would bid me aid a follower of Ilmater.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: I may not care for the Crying God, but I see your turmoil, priest. Let me help.

63.speaker: Player
63.text: It would be a delicious irony if the hollyphant - a celestial - was wrong. I'll look into it.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: You doubt her verdict. I will investigate - see where the true blame falls.

22.speaker: Player
22.text: If there's a trail to follow, I can track it. Let me look into it.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: You should worry more about your temple's safety than this 'Brilgor' person.

42.speaker: Sister Yannis
42.text: I am worried about this temple. Ilmater wills that we try and help people. With Gortash in power...

51.speaker: Player
51.text: Don't be disrespectful, killing is a form of worship.

5.speaker: Sister Yannis
5.text: Not for any God worthy of the name.

65.speaker: Player
65.text: You mean your high priest harbouring criminals?

81.speaker: Sister Yannis
81.text: Brilgor was a criminal, sure, but there's no way he killed Lorgan.

13.speaker: Sister Yannis
13.text: Investigator Valeria might be content to blame the politically convenient target, but I'm not.

11.speaker: Player
11.text: Hah! If more priests spoke muck like you I'd join a church. Nice one.

47.speaker: Player
47.text: I know how annoying planar beings can be. Especially ones from Celestia.
